name: william
text: Did Aaaarthur's ears just curl back in fear?

name: imitationcrab
text: nice pick up!

name: dasilodavi
text: My cat does the same thing.  It's so cute!

name: afrothunder
text: It is sad that they are trying to terrify us by imitating snakes, but they just end up looking cuter!

name: taidje_khan
text: Arthur just got a sense of where Nice Pete was coming from.

name: poodlelucy
text: ...and he did NOT approve.

name: deus
text: I thought he was just confounded.

name: blarghamagarky
text: I wish the other cats used their ears for expression more

name: vermy
text: A cat's ears are the most expressive part of their body.

name: professorhazard
text: I dunno, my cat could probably order a complex lunch simply via the swishing of her tail.

name: woodenteeth
text: fortunately the order is usually "the fish".

name: yomimono
text:
Oh man here goes my first attempt at BBCode I am so nervous in the main

[IMGS OFF]

name: woodenteeth
text: Chubby for reference to the over-wrought, liberal-artism and general wonderfulness of Cat and Girl comics.

name: sirfrederick
text: Seconded.

name: invidious
text:
"Fish!"
"Today's fish is trout a la creme. Enjoy your meal."
"Fish!"
"Today's fish is trout a la creme. Enjoy your meal."
"Fish!"
"Today's fish is trout a la creme. Enjoy your meal."
"Fish!"
"Today's fish is trout a la creme. Enjoy your meal."
"Fish!"
"Today's fish is trout a la creme. Enjoy your meal."
"Fish!"
"Today's fish is trout a la creme. Enjoy your meal."
"I will!"

name: yaotzin
text: I'm gonna get'cha little fishie, I'm gonna get'cha little fishie.

name: gouldgonewild
text: Sorry if this is a stupid question, but is this a Red Dwarf reference?

name: st-elmos_fire
text:
I thought normally cats put their ears back in anger, though it is possible they do it for fear too, it is possibly that fear and anger and the same thing for cats.

Though it makes the strip somewhat stranger if Aaaarthur is angry at Pete for calling the Oscars that.

name: cracklewater
text: It's fight or flight time for Arthur. If it weren't for his Bootsy shades, we might be able to see his suddenly dilated pupils.

name: myxococcus
text: Referring to people as "alive people" is one of the top 10 warning signs for evil villains. Above cold and indifferent mother but not quite as bad as having a hairless cat to pet menacingly.

name: twotonturkey
text: I wonder what Mr. Gary looks like...

name: zem
text: visiting his dead sister?

name: flynn
text: She's not much of a host.

name: zem
text: seriously baffled by the dead sister line

name: xiaomimi
text: I think it's meant to indicate a touchy-feely way of saying he's visiting her grave.

name: woodenteeth
text: I think perhaps visiting his sisters grave is a little more touchy feely than visiting his dead sister. The latter sounding like she is still propped up in a chair somewhere!

name: cracklewater
text: She's under glass, like Lenin.

name: patkun
text: Nothing specific, it's just for people...who need Support.

name: gormster
text: like a wonderbra group?

name: hollis
text: By exclaiming "Oh, how fun" after he shows the photo, Aaaarthur is creating a demand characteristic.  He is a bad experimental psychologist.

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jdhenry105, McNubbins, twohundredninety, Ariamaki, ntopp, odei, Connellingus, apricotta, meowmix, brzbee, Lumus, LaserBlade, TheLastWhiteMan, Setzkin, Hyetal, nutmeg, hellofditties, charchar)

name: kledermans
text: Which is exactly why you got no lames for this.  Don't sell the average Achewood reader short.

name: kledermans
text: I mean, for *that*, not "this".  You did get lames on that comment, precisely because you sold us short.

name: hollis
text: Yeah, I deserved them... I was, in fact, attempting to make a backhanded compliment, but backhanded complimenting is lame.  One should always compliment fronthandedly: Achewood readers rock!

name: sexualhomeboy
text: Your pimp hand is never used to give compliments.  Ever.

name: dougthehead
text: In many Arab countries it is considered a grave insult to greet someone with your pimp hand, or to eat food with it.

name: slalvation
text: But dude, psychology is awesome.

name: sargasm
text: That is kind of abstract but as a psych major I can totally see that.  His design lacks internal validity.

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jdhenry105, wittyname, goocifer, pa_ass_nts, anitrophaeron, pulkbaby)

name: sargasm
text:
Oh, I dunno. I just thought it was a funny word/combination of words when I chose it as my "Inter-Net Handle" way back when.

Anyway, I think we can all agree that is the worst application of the thematic apperception test ever, but we learn a lot about Nice Pete anyway.

name: slow_learner
text: you're thinking of a sargasm

name: woodenteeth
text:
I am so god damned happy people are MEGA-chubbying psych-nerd references. I feel like I belong!

p.s. Crazy people are awesome.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: *how i get paid

name: woodenteeth
text: Actually they don't pay me, the government does.

name: rogergs
text: Nice Pete shows the demand effect by elaborating on what he considers fun: people who are not yet dead whose savory bits will still be nice and warm.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: He gets Nice Pete, which is what bad experimental psychologists like him deserve.

name: mystkmanat
text: I'm taking psych AP this year, and you just completely cracked me up.

name: hyetal
text:
But Arthur is not an experimental psychologist; he is (substituting for) the host of the support group. He wants to support people, and make them feel Good and Happy. He is not showing them inkblots, but photos, likely of traditionally nice things. The next may be a day at the fair, balloons in the air, and the third Christmas morning, c. 1950.

But then, I don't have a fancy-pantsed education; in fact, I've no pants at all, so take this as nothing more than what some Guy said on the Internet.

name: deancain29
text: Aaaarthur looks scared

name: red_dawn
text: Is there anyone other then these guys in Support Group?

name: nathanielperson
text: Nice Pete is a man who gets down to the basics.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Nice Pete sees that the people are alive and that they have different genders. He hates that.

name: joeyramoney
text: that therapist cat is excellent.

name: tttt
text: Pete's head looks pretty sassy in panel four

name: talix18
text: You get the Chubby for making me go back and look, and bust out laughing in agreement.

name: rowboat
text: Oh, no you dit-int!

name: tfaironpirate
text: Dear god he's right...

name: ariamaki
text: If I could see Arthurs eyes behind those star-glasses in panel 7, I think I would see a tiny bit of the abyss right in the middle.

name: spinynorman
text: I got a feeling Pete and Arthur would be a clash that would end up concerning a lot of hefty bags and maybe a nice sturdy hatchet.

name: anitrophaeron
text: Maybe I'll get lamed out of existence for linking to a lolcat on Achewood, but just try and tell me this isn't Arthur in the last panel

name: blahhhhhhh
text: just needs the star sunglasses, really

name: kickstart
text: that cat is so pretty I can barely stand it.

name: postblank
text:
Oh for the love of George, the comments on that website have basically eviscerated my brain.

It is Arthur, though.

name: ravindra108
text:
I dunno... This is more the impression I got:
[IMGS OFF]

name: gbeaton
text: I can't look at Arthur and not see Ray's Halloween costume, going as himself.

name: cailetshadow
text: Arthur has quickly learned that it is best not to know where Nice Pete is coming from.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: Saw Tina.
Roast Beef: Room To Let
Pat: This is MY blog, NOT yours!
Teodor: Clams
Philippe: Captain Kirk Toothpaste
Lyle: pumpies on vac'n
Onstad: Some thoughts on my vacation to Kauai

name: i_love_kate
text:
Man, I ain't mean to bitch against Onstad, but the blogs kind of work against Philippe. He's a novelty character at best, cuteness and naivete being his two core character traits. But while all the other characters get this amazingly profound and layered persona from their blog entries, Philippe's just kind of provides a chuckle and a smile and nothing much new.

Incidentally, thanks Xiaomimi.

name: tekende
text:
Yeah, but, I mean, he's only five. A five-year-old is not going to have very profound things to write in a blog.

And anyway, some of the Philippe entries are very good. "Bath Day!" is a particular favorite of mine.

name: tfaironpirate
text:
I dunno about that. I mean, I think I've my most weirdly sympathetic moments with Philippe. Like, things I would of never thought about, but totally already knew and had had happen to me. And, I mean, of course he doesn't have as much going on yet, he's only five...

...and needs your support. DAMNIT! I tried so hard not to make a reference!

name: kelissamunz
text: I love how chubby Arthur is. I just want to pick him up and squeeze him.

name: ctaronno
text: Aaaarthur truly is adorable.

name: kickstart
text: he's so cute.  with the glasses and the ascot, a definite Charles Nelson Reilly vibe going on.

name: storableprawn
text:
I'm probably really lame for noticing this so late into the archive, especially on my second pass through it, but: Most of the Achewood cast is always facing at a 3/4 angle, with a few exceptions, while Nice Pete is always a straight profile or staring right at the reader.

Dude is somewhere around 800 times more creepy since I've noticed this.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...why does Nice Pete have a droop under his eye when responding to Arthur..?

name: greenkoolayd
text: its a little muscle spasm, caused by momentary control of his homicidal urge.  it goes away the second he starts swing the axe.

name: tragicone
text:
arthurs expression made me laugh uncontrollably.

the silence says it all.

name: andrewthepig
text:
I imagine that in the Achewood universe, Arthur and Garfield have the same voice.

Up yours Garfield
